page.title: 01Local farmer
page.content: An interview with a local farmer. Mr. Glen Davies has lived at Cwmnanthopkin Farm all his life. His family came to live there in 1890 but the farm was mentioned in manorial rolls in 1610.Mr. Davies runs a stock farm on his 7o acres of land. he used to be a dairy farmer but now he runs a suckler calf system. he has 75 cows and calves, Herefords, Friesians,and Aberdeen Angus crossed with a Charolais bull.He takes his calves to Carmarthen market to sell them. Although he has two tractors, a JCB and a trailer, he employs a contractor to make the silage to feed his stock in the winter.Cwmnanthopkin is one of eleven farms on the Penlerfedwen Mountain, most of which is owned by the NCB.
